Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Model-Based RSA for Cementless Tapered Wedge Femoral Stem

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to model-based RSA or marker-based RSA using computer-generated random numbers

Participants.evidence: the study included patients undergoing THA with cementless tapered wedge femoral stems

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to model-based RSA or marker-based RSA

Objective.evidence: This study aims to verify the accuracy and clinical precision of model-based radiostereometric analysis (RSA) compared to conventional marker-based RSA

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the accuracy of RSA measurements

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to model-based RSA or marker-based RSA using computer-generated random numbers, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group assignments

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 24 patients were randomised, with 12 allocated to each group

Result_Outcome.evidence: The accuracy of model-based RSA was 0.03 mm for subsidence (95% CI, −0.03–0.00) and 0.39° for rotation (95% CI, −0.41 to −0.06)

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group
